arts.ttl: Maxim De Cuyper and Danny Welbeck pounce late as Brighton punish 10-man Chelsea
arts.sum: The rumblings of discontent at Chelsea grow louder. The frustration from the Stamford Bridge crowd was audible as they watched their team lose at home in the Premier League for the first time since last December. Enzo Maresca’s substitutions came under the spotlight again and Chelsea, who are facing a defensive crisis before hosting Liverpool next weekend, were in a giving mood during this 3-1 defeat to Brighton. It was sweet for Brighton, given how many players and executives have swapped the south coast for west London during the past three years. The celebrations were wild when Danny Welbeck’s second goal of the afternoon wrapped up the points deep into added time. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Late DRAMA! Two stoppage-time goals give Brighton comeback win over 10-man Chelsea
arts.sum: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Chelsea's match against Brighton in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Chelsea fans want Maresca sacked after Brighton loss: 'Everything's broken'
arts.sum: Chelsea fans are getting increasingly frustrated with Enzo Maresca's management after his side suffered a defeat against Brighton . Chelsea fans want Maresca sacked after Brighton loss: 'Everything's broken'

arts.ttl: Brighton net twice at the death to claim comeback win away to 10-man Chelsea
arts.sum: Danny Welbeck scored a brace in Brighton’s comeback win at Chelsea.

arts.ttl: Chelsea Player Ratings vs. Brighton: Chalobah Red Card Sparks Collapse in 3–1 Defeat
arts.sum: The Blues had a stranglehold on the game but things quickly turned at Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Chalobah red proves costly as Brighton stage dramatic comeback to beat Chelsea
arts.sum: Trevoh Chalobah's 53rd-minute red card proved costly for Chelsea as Brighton came from behind to secure a dramatic 3-1 victory at Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Chelsea vs Brighton team news LIVE!
arts.sum: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca has confirmed that Cole Palmer will undergo a period of rest to fix an ongoing groin issue. Palmer, who was withdrawn after 21 minutes at Man Utd last weekend, is likely to be missing until after the next international break.
